title: Account Security Question
body: Why doesn't Riot implement a system that if you try to log into the client from a new IP address, it prompts you to confirm through email?

replies.body:
I think the idea is good, but it doesn't work in practice.  Many players work on dynamic IP's, so it is possible they will get flagged without ever moving.  Additionally, many League players play on Laptops, and travel to different locations to play:  Their friends house, library, PC Cafe, School, etc.  Having to confirm every single time and get barred from entry would provide more pain than it would solve.

We are dedicated to account security, which is why we enabled email verification and are continuing to work on new features as well.

I hope this helps give some extra info!

How about a computer ID system? All computers have their own identification. Same description as above but with using computer hardware in the stead of an IP. I have never personally have had my account breached, but I think there should be an extra security measure between having a password and being able to log on.

 Perhaps even an e-mail that says "Hey, a new IP has accessed your account "123.123.123" is this you? If it is not, your account may be compromised. click here to lock your account and change your password"

Maybe follow the lead of Steam with an optional mobile authentication app.

Perhaps even my original suggestion, but make it optional for account settings.

I certainly would not want 2 years worth of time wasted on a game that I lose all the progress on. It'd be as bad as spending 2 years on a huge project in Minecraft or another building simulator, all to just have it deleted one day because of a hardware malfunction. It would **really** suck.
